main event: A very bright light or flash was reported in the Jacksonville, Florida area on March 11, 1965, observed by multiple witnesses who identified it as a meteor.
interesting points: The object was observed at an elevation of 45-50 degrees and was described as a very bright single light or flash,Three witnesses reported the light as a meteor, with one stating it was blue in color,Aircraft pilots and civilian witnesses both reported seeing the object momentarily with no movement detected, The brightness of the object captured the attention of all witnesses but no sound was reported, The conclusion was that the object was likely a meteor.
sighted object: very bright single light or flash
witness description: Civilian observers including pilots from various aircraft
